alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 19 at 8:54PM MDT until June 20 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS, CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry, and unstable conditions will return Tuesday with poor overnight humidity recovery. Breezy to locally windy southwest to west winds will combine with low relative humidity to create several hours of critical fire weather for portions of New Mexico. Any fires that develop will have the potential for rapid fire growth in receptive fuel beds. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) from Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 40 mph Tuesday afternoon and evening. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 8 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended..
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
